pullRequest.body:
Add the lemma

```lean
lemma nth_add_one {n : ℕ} (h0 : ¬p 0) (h : nth p n ≠ 0) :
    nth (fun i ↦ p (i + 1)) n + 1 = nth p n := by
```

and its variant

```lean
lemma nth_add_one_eq_sub {n : ℕ} (h0 : ¬p 0) (h : nth p n ≠ 0) :
    nth (fun i ↦ p (i + 1)) n = nth p n - 1 := by
```

Feel free to golf; it seems like there ought to be a much shorter proof, possibly following a different approach.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e96a91ee4f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18836/commits/e96a91ee4f77edf60112354bc6f54c6550c896f4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ nth_add`
`+ nth_add_eq_sub`
`+ nth_add_one`
`+ nth_add_one_eq_sub`
`+ nth_comp_of_strictMono`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

It does seem surprising that there isn't an easier proof here.

I wonder if generalising to `f (nth (p ∘ f) k) = nth (fun i => p i ∧ i ∈ image f) k` for an arbitrary order embedding `f : ℕ → ℕ` would end up being easier.

That doesn't seem like it would be any easier to me. Maybe there's some kind of induction principle for `nth` that could abstract proofs of such things, though I suspect such a principle would be awkward to use in practice.
Maybe `+ 1` could be `+ m` and the proof is the same (the `h0` should be `∀ k < m, ¬ p k`)?

I've refactored to have such a version with `+ m` (which may well introduce fresh scope for golfing the proof again). This isn't the fully general version with an order embedding (where `h0 : ∀ k, p k → k ∈ Set.range f` would be more closely analogous to these lemmas than the suggested version with a different `p` on the RHS).

I've now pushed a more general `nth_comp_of_strictMono` lemma for order embeddings (which also uses the more general but more awkward `∀ hfi : (setOf p).Finite, n < hfi.toFinset.card` in place of `nth p n ≠ 0`) - this is my version with the same `p` on both sides, not the one suggested with a different `p` on the RHS. That change did make the file shorter, but there is probably again scope for more golfing.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Nat/Nth): `nth_add_one`
